fields.description:
Class {{Resource}} has three sub classes(FixedValueResource, LightWeightResource, and ResourcePBImpl). Only FixedValueResource handle long-to-int casting nicely. The other two didn't. This bug is introduced by resource type feature and causes several unit test failures. For example:
{code}
Error Message

expected:<<memory:4096, vCores:4>> but was:<<memory:4096, vCores:-1>>
Stacktrace

java.lang.AssertionError: expected:<<memory:4096, vCores:4>> but was:<<memory:4096, vCores:-1>>
	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)
	at org.junit.Assert.failNotEquals(Assert.java:743)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:118)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:144)
	at org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.scheduler.fair.TestFSAppAttempt.testHeadroomWithBlackListedNodes(TestFSAppAttempt.java:325)
{code}
fields.summary: Fix unsafe casting from long to int for class Resource and its sub-classes

comments.body: The patch is straightforward. [~wangda]/[~templedf], could you take a look?

This message was automatically generated.

Thanks [~yufeigu]. Approach makes sense to me.

I am not very sure about the idea of having a new test class named TestResource. I think we usually have tests for impl classes. However we need to test this case, so is it fine to move to an impl class and test this case.
I think its better to keep {{resourceValueLongToInt}} as non-static.

Thanks [~sunilg] for the review.
# I'm not sure either, but I think if we want to test class {{Resource}}. {{TestResource}} is the best place to do that. 
# Can you elaborate why non-static is better?

Thanks, [~yufeigu].  My comments:
# You're missing a space after the _if_ in your method.
# Since it's now static, can we name it more appropriately, like {{castToIntSafely()}} or some such?  (I don't see any reason for it to be non-static.)
# Assert messages would be nice.
# I don't mind adding the {{TestResource}} class just for this.  Maybe name it something more specific, though, like {{TestResourceLongCast}} or something?
# You should also test that the {{getMemory()}} and {{getVirtualCores()}} methods behave correctly in the impl classes.

Thanks for the review, [~templedf]. Uploaded patch v2 for your comments. 
For the name of test class, I assume it is a convention to use "Test" + [class to be tested] as the test class name. In that case, "TestResource" is the name we should use. Am I wrong?

javac warning is related.

In {{TestResourcePBImpl}}, please use {{res.getMemorySize}} instead of {{res.getMemory}} ?

It is related. This patch intends to test {{getMemory()}} instead of {{getMemorySize()}} because the {{getMemory()}} does the unsafe casting. It would be OK to call the deprecated method in unit test in this case.

[~sunilg],

bq. please use res.getMemorySize instead of res.getMemory
I think this is added to test getMemory behavior, [~yufeigu], could you suppress this warning? 

Beyond this patch LGTM.
Yes. Correct. Fine from my end as well. Thanks.
Thanks [~wangda]. Uploaded patch v5 for your comment.

LGTM.  On the test class name, there's certainly lots of precedent for test-specific names, e.g. {{TestSchedulingWithAllocationRequestId}}, {{TestIncreaseAllocationExpirer}}, and {{TestKillApplicationWithRMHA}}.  I don't actually care, though.  Sounds like [~sunilg], who originally was worried about it, is fine with it, so I'm good, too.  +1
